176.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED). She alleged that "some BJP leaders are doing this for their interests". A resolution was passed in the state Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies.

177.title: The film is all about love which is beyond one's life: Jackie on 'Atithi...'
177.article_body: Veteran actor Jackie Shroff, speaking about his upcoming movie 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava', said, "The film is all about love which is beyond one's life." He added that the feeling of love has been expressed in a beautiful and sensitive way in the film. Directed by Hardik Gajjar, 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava' will also feature Pratik Gandhi and Sharmin Segal.

178.title: MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt visits Palampur military station
178.article_body: Union Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt visited the Palampur military station in Himachal Pradesh on Monday where he interacted with personnel of the Indian Army's Dah Division, officials said. The minister was briefed on operational preparedness, PRO (Defence) Jammu informed. Bhatt was also briefed on various innovations by units of the Dah Division, the official added.

179.title: Fraudster abused me when I told him I was in 'Jamtara': Amit Sial
179.article_body: Actor Amit Sial revealed that his mother was almost scammed after a fraudster asked her for a "UPI number" over an airline refund. Amit further stated, "I took the phone...I asked him if he had seen 'Jamtara', he said yes, I told him I have acted in it." He said the fraudster then abused him and disconnected the call.

180.title: I'm over 'who wore it better' collages: Janhvi on equation with Sara, Ananya
180.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about her equation with her contemporaries Ananya Panday, Sara Ali Khan and Tara Sutaria, said it's one of mutual respect. "At this point, we are just over...stupid 'who wore it better' collages, or...who's doing what," she added. Janhvi further said though there's "an element of insecurity" in all of them, they're very confident about their individual personalities.

181.title: Ukrainian shelling kills 13 in Donetsk, Pro-Russia officials say
181.article_body: At least 13 civilians were killed in shelling by Ukrainian forces in the city of Donetsk, its pro-Russia authorities claimed on Monday. "The number of people injured is being determined," the city's Moscow-backed mayor stated. Donetsk city is the administrative centre of Ukraine's breakaway Donetsk region. The region has been partially under the control of Moscow-backed separatists since 2014.

182.title: Want to entertain fans once again with batting: Gujarat Giants skipper Sehwag
182.article_body: Talking about playing in Legends League Cricket, Gujarat Giants skipper Virender Sehwag said he would try to entertain his fans once again with his batting after getting an opportunity to return to the cricketing field. "And I hope our team keeps playing well...wins the trophy," he added. Legends League Cricket is a global league with ex-cricketers playing competitive cricket.

183.title: Not 1 type of weaponry bought for defence forces under UPA: Amarinder Singh
183.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said "not even one type of weapon was ever purchased for Army, Navy or Air Force" under UPA government. "Now, weaponry is coming, which is necessary for us if we are to secure our nation," Singh said. He added that Congress is responsible for China being ahead of India in weaponry.

184.title: PM Modi to address meeting of all BJP mayors tomorrow
184.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a meeting of all BJP mayors at 10.30 am on Tuesday. "With growing urbanisation, it is important that we view it as an opportunity and work together towards building modern [and] futuristic cities," he said. PM Modi will virtually inaugurate the National Mayors' Conference on Tuesday morning in Gujarat's Gandhinagar.

185.title: 3 workers die after inhaling toxic gas inside illegal Assam coal mine
185.article_body: Three workers of an illegal coal mine located in Lido in Assam's Tinsukia district died on Sunday night after allegedly inhaling toxic gas, police said. So far, five persons have been arrested following the incident, according to police. "The 'rat hole' mine was being run illegally on a hill top," Tinsukia SP Debojit Deuri said.

186.title: Couple found hanging in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal
186.article_body: A 45-year-old man and his wife were found hanging from separate trees in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal district on Monday. The deceased, Monoranjan Nayak and Smitanjali, were residents of nearby Paburia village and might have died by suicide over some family dispute, police said. Notably, Nayak and his wife worked as Gaon Sathi and ASHA worker respectively.

187.title: Entry of devotees into sanctum sanctorum in Kedarnath Temple banned
187.article_body: The entry of devotees into the sanctum sanctorum of Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand has been banned for the time being in view of a huge rush of pilgrims. Devotees cannot go beyond the 'sabha mandap' for darshan till the ban is in force, Shri Badarinath Kedarnath Temple Committee said. The restriction can be removed only when the crowd gets smaller.

188.title: SBI asks exporters to trade with Bangladesh in rupee, taka: Report
188.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) asked exporters to avoid trading with Bangladesh using the dollar and instead use rupee or taka, Reuters reported. SBI is looking to protect Bangladesh's declining foreign reserves which have fallen from $48 billion a year earlier to $37 billion. Bangladesh Commerce Minister Tipu Munshi had said they want to cut dependency on the dollar.

189.title: Himachal to spend ₹3 crore to build quarters for govt employees: CM Thakur
189.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said that the state government will spend ₹3 crore to build residential accommodations for Class III and IV employees in the state's Kangra district. "The state government has cleared and fulfilled various dues and demands of the government officers," CM Thakur said. He added that the government is committed towards the welfare of its employees.

190.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin lowered into royal vault ahead of burial, pic surfaces
190.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin has been lowered into the royal vault inside St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle in Berkshire, UK. She will be buried later in a private family service. The Queen will be laid to rest near her late husband Prince Philip, sister Princess Margaret and parents King George VI and Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother.

191.title: I don't agree with Akshay Kumar but I don't want his films to flop: Swara
191.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that Bollywood should not make itself a platform for propaganda. She added Bollywood is not a tangible and homogenous entity. Swara stated, "There could never be one voice coming out of the industry...I don't agree with Akshay Kumar because of the kind of films he supports...that doesn't mean I want his films to flop."

192.title: Hurricane Fiona hits Dominican Republic after Puerto Rico
192.article_body: Hurricane Fiona made landfall in the Dominican Republic early on Monday. The storm is predicted to unleash as much as 15 inches of rain in the eastern part of the Caribbean nation. Earlier on Sunday, Fiona struck Puerto Rico, causing a power outage that has affected over 1.4 million people. There were no immediate reports of deaths.

193.title: NARCL plans to buy 18 distressed accounts with ₹39,921cr debt: Report
193.article_body: National Asset Reconstruction Company of India Ltd is planning to acquire 18 distressed accounts with ₹39,921 crore debt by October 31, a report said. NARCL has reportedly created two lists, with phase one having eight accounts with ₹16,744 debt and phase two having 10 accounts with ₹18,177 debt. Jaypee Infrastructure and Meenakshi Energy are among the companies in phase one.

194.title: Actor Kartik Aaryan flies economy class, video from inside the plane goes viral
194.article_body: A video of actor Kartik Aaryan flying economy class has gone viral. In the video, co-passengers can be seen cheering for him and taking photographs with him. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Very humble and down to earth person." Other comments read, "Yeh hai real actor," and "Most humble star in Bollywood who feels proud to be among...people."

195.title: TSSC opens Centre of Excellence in partnership with Huawei in Patna
195.article_body: Telecom Sector Skill Council (TSSC), a skill development institution for the telecom industry, has opened a 'Centre of Excellence' (CoE) at NIT Patna in collaboration with Huawei Technologies. TSSC said the CoE will cater to roles in information and communications technology, cybersecurity, electronics and communication. Former Telecom and IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad inaugurated the centre.

196.title: Volkswagen sets price range for Porsche IPO, to raise up to $9.4 bn
196.article_body: Volkswagen has set a price range for the IPO of luxury sports car maker Porsche AG. The price range per preferred share was set at 76.50 euros to 82.50 euros which would result in proceeds of 8.71 billion to 9.39 billion euros. Porsche's share capital has been divided into 50% preferred and 50% ordinary shares.

197.title: George V metro station in Paris renamed 'Elizabeth II' for a day
197.article_body: A station on the Paris metro rail network named after Queen Elizabeth II's grandfather was renamed out of respect for the late Queen on her funeral day, Paris's public transit authority informed on Monday. The George V station was renamed "Elizabeth II". Signs at the station were replaced as part of the change that is to remain for a day.

198.title: Govt plans to sell 2 Air India subsidiaries by end-FY23: Report
198.article_body: The government is planning to privatise Air India's (AI) ground handling and engineering services by the end of FY23, according to reports. Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) has already started conducting roadshows with potential buyers to sell AI Airport Services and AI Engineering Services. Adani Group, Tata Sons and Swissport are reportedly interested in the offer.

199.title: Gabriel Jesus is the game-changer for Arsenal: Alan Shearer
199.article_body: Praising Gabriel Jesus, ex-Newcastle United player Alan Shearer said the striker is the "game-changer" for Arsenal, adding he sets the tone from the front. "Defenders hate players who are prepared to run in behind, he does that. He's the one who starts the press," he further said. Jesus has scored four goals in seven league matches in the season.

200.title: Meghan Markle breaks down in tears at Queen Elizabeth's funeral
200.article_body: The Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle broke down in tears during Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral at Westminster Abbey on Monday. Pictures showed her wiping away tears as she attended the Queen's funeral with other royals alongside her husband, Prince Harry. Markle broke down in tears as the Queen's coffin was transferred into a hearse at Wellington Arch.

201.title: Till today she says 'I was the one who discovered you': Madhur on Tabu
201.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said in an interview that actress Tabu is one of the main reasons why he is still working today. "Tabu believed in me. Till today she says 'I was the one who discovered you', and really, I have to give it to her," he added. "She worked with me knowing...I had a flop behind me," said Madhur.

202.title: ECB looking to offer James Anderson and Stuart Broad player-coach role: Reports
202.article_body: The ECB is reportedly devising a plan wherein pace bowlers James Anderson and Stuart Broad could be made player-coaches. Test coach Brendon McCullum is looking to streamline the support staff and might let the two pacers groom their successors, said the report. ECB may reportedly leave one of the pacers out in future Tests and assign them to oversee practice.

203.title: Alonso gave people €1,500 to support him over Hamilton: Ex-McLaren staffer
203.article_body: A former McLaren mechanic has revealed that Fernando Alonso had used financial incentives to lure people to his side of the team while he was teammates with Lewis Hamilton. Alonso is said to have handed envelopes with cash worth approximately €1,500 to incentivise all members to support him. The team bosses later made everyone give the money to charity.

204.title: It is going to be memorable playing in front of Pakistani crowds: Moeen
204.article_body: Ahead of England's upcoming tour to Pakistan for the first time in 17 years, English all-rounder Moeen Ali said that "it is going to be memorable playing in front of the Pakistani crowds". "An immense honour to deputize for Jos Buttler...and captain England," Moeen said. The 35-year-old cricketer added, "Seven T20Is will be a stern test in these (Pakistan) conditions."

205.title: Unmanned excavator removes 4,700 tonnes of silt from Chennai's waterways
205.article_body: Over 4,700 tonnes of silt and hyacinth were removed from Chennai's waterways using an unmanned robotic excavator, the Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) said. Nearly 25 streams and canals, including those in Trustpuram, Virugambakkam and Teynampet, have been cleared. "We're tirelessly working towards clearing all the drains and waterways...before the monsoon arrives," a senior GCC official said.

206.title: Sad to hear this news: Karanvir on TV actress Nishi Singh's death
206.article_body: Actor Karanvir Bohra took to Instagram Stories and mourned the demise of TV actress Nishi Singh. Karanvir shared a post related to Nishi's death and wrote, "Sad to hear this news." Nishi had appeared in TV shows like 'Ishqbaaz', 'Qubool Hai' and 'Tenali Rama'. She had suffered three strokes of paralysis in the last few years.

207.title: Heard Medvedev say he felt pressure of being no. 1, I haven't felt it: Alcaraz
207.article_body: US Open champion Carlos Alcaraz said he hasn't felt any pressure since becoming world number one last week. "I heard Daniil Medvedev say that he felt the pressure of being number one, that he thought it was going to be easier," he added. "In my case, maybe it's because I've played...Davis Cup had...warmth of all the people," he further said.

208.title: I'm not in that dumb race: Agnihotri on reports of 'Brahmāstra' beating 'The Kashmir...'
208.article_body: Reacting to reports saying 'Brahmāstra' beat 'The Kashmir Files' in box office, 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Hahaha...I don't know how did they beat #TheKashmirFiles...with sticks, rods, hockey...or AK47 or stones...Or with paid PR and influencers?" He added, "Let Bollywood films compete with each other. Leave us alone. I am not in that dumb race. Thanks. #NotBollywood."

209.title: Kangana shares childhood pics, says relatives called her Indira Gandhi
209.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has revealed that her relatives used to call her Indira Gandhi when she was a child. Sharing throwback pictures from her childhood on Instagram Stories, she wrote, "I didn't follow anyone's hairstyle as a kid." Kangana added, "I went to...village barber...and guided him to do [the] haircut...I liked, and I always liked it short...this inspired many jokes in...family."

210.title: J&K notifies holiday on Maharaja Hari Singh's birth anniversary on Sept 23
210.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has notified late Maharaja Hari Singh's birth anniversary on September 23 as a holiday. A notification issued on Monday stated that all government offices and educational institutes across the Union Territory will observe the holiday every year. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha earlier said that the holiday is a tribute to the Maharaja's services.

211.title: Women beat man with belts, tear his shirt outside Raipur airport; video surfaces
211.article_body: A video showing a group of women beating a man with belts, slapping him repeatedly and tearing his shirt in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, has surfaced online. The video was recorded outside Raipur airport and reports have said that both the parties have filed police complaints against each other. The scuffle reportedly broke out over a monetary dispute.

212.title: India to collaborate in 41 business areas with Saudi Arabia: Report
212.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Monday met Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman Al Saud. He co-chaired a meeting with him wherein the nations reportedly agreed to collaborate in 41 business areas of agriculture and food security, energy, technology and IT and industry and infrastructure. Goyal participated in a CEO Roundtable with Saudi Arabia's prominent businessmen.

213.title: 16-year-old Dalit girl who was gang-raped & set afire in UP dies
213.article_body: A Dalit girl, who was set on fire after being gang-raped by two men in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit district on September 7, succumbed to her injuries on Monday while undergoing treatment. "The 16-year-old had suffered 68% burn injuries," King George's Medical University's spokesperson said. The two suspects in the case have been arrested and sent to judicial custody.

214.title: I think it'll be Cummins: Ponting on his pick for Aus' next ODI captain
214.article_body: Predicting Australia's next ODI captain following Aaron Finch's ODI retirement, Ricky Ponting said, "I think it'll be Pat Cummins, to be honest."  He added, "I know he doesn't play all...ODIs for obvious reasons, because his workload in Test cricket has been...very high in...last few years. I'll be surprised if it wasn't Cummins." Cummins is currently the Test captain of Australia.

215.title: Pak court quashes terror charges against former PM Imran Khan
215.article_body: The Islamabad High Court on Monday quashed terror-related charges against Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a case where he is accused of issuing threats against a female judge. During a rally last month, Khan had allegedly warned the judge of dire consequences for remanding his top aide Shahbaz Gill to 48-hour police custody in a sedition case.

216.title: Brahmāstra becomes second Bollywood film to earn ₹200 crore in India in 2022
216.article_body: Ayan Mukerji-directorial 'Brahmāstra' crossed the ₹200-crore mark in 10 days of its release. With this, it became the second Bollywood film to earn ₹200 crore domestically in 2022 after Vivek Agnihotri-directorial 'The Kashmir Files'. 'Brahmāstra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. 'The Kashmir Files' raked in more than ₹250 crore at the domestic box office.

217.title: Hindu-Muslim clashes break out in UK city after India-Pak match, 15 arrested
217.article_body: Large-scale unrest has been reported in UK's Leicester over the past few days, with groups from Hindu and Muslim communities clashing on the streets. Tension was first reported on August 28, the day of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup T20 cricket match. At least 15 people have been arrested following the violent clashes reported over the weekend, police said.

218.title: Working towards how I can improve as an opening batter: KL Rahul
218.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against Australia, KL Rahul said he's working on how he can improve as an opening batter and give more impact to the Indian team. In the recently concluded Asia Cup, the 30-year-old scored 132 runs in five matches at an average of 26.40. The first T20I will be played in Mohali on Tuesday.

219.title: Ambuja's shares at all-time high after being acquired by Adani Group
219.article_body: Shares of Ambuja Cements hit an all-time high on Monday after being acquired by the billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group. The cement maker's shares jumped nearly 10% to ₹568 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Notably, with the completion of the acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC, Adani Group has now become the country's second-largest cement player.

220.title: Wasim Jaffer names his India playing XI for first T20I against Australia
220.article_body: Former Team India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to name his Team India playing XI for the first T20I against Australia. He included KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma as openers, followed by Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya. He chose Dinesh Karthik over Rishabh Pant in his XI. The first T20I will take place on Tuesday in Mohali.

221.title: Took about 6 months, 3 teachers to get 'Thank God' song right: Yohani
221.article_body: Sri Lankan singer Yohani, speaking about learning Hindi for her song 'Manike' in 'Thank God', has said that it took her too long. "It took about six months...three teachers just to get one song so I'm not too sure how I am going to get the rest of it," she added. However, Yohani added that she enjoyed the process.

222.title: Fairfax Group-backed Go Digit's IPO put in 'abeyance' by SEBI
222.article_body: The proposed initial share sale of the Fairfax Group-backed Go Digit has been put in 'abeyance' by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). Go Digit filed its preliminary IPO papers on August 16. The market regulator didn't disclose the reason and on its website said "issuance of observations (has been) kept in abeyance" about Go Digit's IPO.

223.title: He speaks about love without fear: Zafar after Arijit says 'I'll come to Pak'
223.article_body: Pakistani actor-singer Ali Zafar has said that singer Arijit Singh deserves praise for speaking about love fearlessly on the big stage. This comes after Arijit, who was performing in the US in May, told a Pakistani fan that he will be visiting the country soon. "I think Arijit is a beautiful human being and a singer," Ali said.

224.title: Sikh delegation ties 'Pagdi, offers 'Siropa' to PM Modi
224.article_body: A delegation from Gurdwara Bala Sahib met PM Narendra Modi on Monday during which he reiterated his government's commitment to continuously work for the welfare of the Sikh community. The Sikh delegation honoured PM Modi by tying a 'Pagdi' and offering a 'Siropa' to him. PM Modi thanked the delegation for their wishes and prayers for his well-being, officials said.

225.title: Audience will see an unfiltered side of me: Bhavana on her 'Koffee...' debut
225.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey, speaking about her debut on Karan Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I am simply elated." She added that the audience will get to see "a more flamboyant, unfiltered side" of her on the show. Bhavana is the wife of actor Chunky Panday and mother of actress Ananya Panday.

226.title: Zoom's flaws let hackers join meetings stealthily, update immediately: CERT-In
226.article_body: Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has asked users to immediately update Zoom as its security flaws may let hackers join a meeting stealthily. Hackers may also get access to confidential information shared during Zoom meetings as their name won't be visible to other participants, CERT-In said. "These vulnerabilities exist due to improper access control implementation," it added.

227.title: Centre asks Google to take stringent steps to curb illegal lending apps: Report
227.article_body: Google has been asked by Centre to introduce more stringent checks to help curb use of illegal digital lending applications in India, Reuters reported. Google has been called to meetings several times in last few months by RBI and Centre to urge it to introduce tougher checks. "We've removed over 2,000 personal loan apps...from Play Store," a Google spokesperson said.

228.title: This is a party working in India's interest: Amarinder on joining BJP
228.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh after joining BJP on Monday said this is a party working in the interest of the country. "I thank the leadership of BJP for welcoming us. I discussed it with all my party members and we decided to do this," Singh said. He also merged his newly-formed Punjab Lok Congress (PLC) with BJP.

229.title: Allahabad University student leader tries to self-immolate over fee hike
229.article_body: A student leader of Allahabad University allegedly tried to immolate himself on Monday, amid the ongoing protest by students against fee hike for various courses in the 2022-23 academic year. Police, who were present on the spot, stopped him from immolating himself. The incident was followed by a clash between the police and the protesting students.

230.title: Spanish tourist bitten by monkeys while taking photos at Taj Mahal
230.article_body: A female tourist from Spain was on Monday bitten by monkeys on the Taj Mahal premises in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. As per reports, the woman was attacked when she was trying to take photographs of the monument. A video showing the woman getting first aid treatment has surfaced on social media.

231.title: BJP-ED-CBI alliance will contest Guj Assembly, Delhi civic polls: AAP
231.article_body: AAP National Spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday said an alliance of BJP, ED and CBI will be contesting Gujarat's Assembly polls and Delhi's civic body polls. "Meaning of ED calling [AAP leader] Durgesh Pathak is clear - [Delhi's civic body polls] are going to take place," Bharadwaj said. Pathak was called for questioning in relation with Delhi's excise policy scam.

232.title: Dish TV shares up 10% as Chairman Jawahar Goel resigns from board
232.article_body: Direct-to-Home operator Dish TV on Monday said that its Chairman Jawahar Lal Goel has resigned from his position. "Jawahar Lal Goel...has tendered his resignation from the company's board of directors and committee/s thereof with effect from the close of business hours of September 19," Dish TV said in a regulatory filing. The company's shares surged nearly 10% following the announcement.

233.title: She's beautiful inside out: Trisha on 'Ponniyin...' co-star Aishwarya
233.article_body: Actress Trisha, sharing her experience of working with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan', said she and Aishwarya shared a warm and comfortable vibe on the sets. "There were times when Mani sir would come and say, 'Stop talking, I can't have this camaraderie for my scene'," she added. "She's beautiful inside and out," Trisha further said.

234.title: It's conceptualised as trilogy: Alia on Dimple's role in 'Brahmastra'
234.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said director Ayan Mukerji has a larger thought for every character that featured in 'Brahmastra: Part One - Shiva'. She stated, "It's conceptualised as a trilogy...people have asked me about Dimple Kapadia you have seen her for 2.5 seconds but why and how?" Alia added, "You can always think...the makers...have something in mind for every character."

235.title: 3 accused in Chandigarh University video leak case sent to 7-day police remand
235.article_body: A court in Punjab's Mohali sent the three accused arrested over the alleged leak of videos of girls at Chandigarh University to seven-day police remand. Police have arrested the accused woman, but said she only sent her own video to her boyfriend in Shimla, who was also arrested on Sunday. Another man was arrested from Himachal Pradesh in this case.

236.title: Mob vandalises temple & removes saffron flag in UK, India condemns incident
236.article_body: The Indian High Commission in the UK has 'strongly condemned' the incident wherein a temple was vandalised by a mob in Leicester and a saffron flag erected there was removed. "We've strongly taken up this matter with the UK authorities and...sought immediate action against those involved in the attack," it said. Videos showing the attack have gone viral on Twitter.

237.title: Raj BJP MLA brings a cow to Vidhan Sabha over spread of lumpy skin disease
237.article_body: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Pushkar, Suresh Singh Rawat, brought a cow to the state's Assembly premises on Monday to draw attention towards the spread of lumpy skin disease. Cows are suffering but the state government is in a deep slumber, Rawat said. The cow later went out of control due to excessive noise while Rawat talked to reporters.

238.title: Dropouts-turned-founders like Kamath are exceptionally brilliant people: Ashneer
238.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover said college dropouts who went on to start their own companies, like Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath, are "exceptionally brilliant people". "[Those dropouts] felt like the formal education process is a waste of their time. They felt they can learn quicker than that education process. And those people have gone and built exceptional businesses," Grover added.

239.title: James promised acting won't be overshadowed by technology in Avatar: Sam
239.article_body: Actor Sam Worthington revealed that director James Cameron promised him that his acting in 'Avatar' will not be overshadowed by technology. "It was the truth. And that was the promise that he made me, and that's what came out...It was just there. And that's the essence that I saw," Sam added. Sam will feature in 'Avatar: The Way of Water'.

240.title: Yati Narsinghanand, 2 others booked for hate speech in UP's Aligarh
240.article_body: Yati Narsinghanand, head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, along with two others, have been booked for allegedly making inflammatory statements against a particular community, police said on Monday. The accused, including an Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha functionary and her husband, allegedly made the statements during a religious programme held in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Sunday night.

241.title: ED files chargesheet against Partha, his aide in recruitment scam
241.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday submitted a chargesheet before a special court against former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. They both were arrested by the ED on July 23. As per the chargesheet, there are 43 witnesses in the case.

242.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
242.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Heavy rainfall is very likely over parts of Assam, Meghalaya and Madhya Pradesh till September 23. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha till September 21 and over Arunachal Pradesh on September 22 and 23. Andhra Pradesh and Telangana may witness heavy rainfall till September 21.

243.title: Gangster with 25 criminal cases shot dead outside court in Rajasthan
243.article_body: A gangster was shot dead by four-five unidentified assailants outside a court in Rajasthan's Nagaur when he was about to appear before the court on Monday. The gangster, Sandeep Sethi, came out of jail on bail last week. He had 25 criminal cases registered against him, a police officer said. The accused came on bikes and fired 9-10 rounds.

244.title: Man dies in Thane's Ulhasnagar after adjacent building's wall falls on him
244.article_body: A 60-year-old man was killed and his 58-year-old wife injured in Thane district's Ulhasnagar after a slab of a wall from an adjacent building collapsed on their roof on Sunday. The man, who recently celebrated his 38th wedding anniversary, was still in bed when the wall came falling through the roof. Municipal authorities said they'd recommended repairs to the building.

245.title: King Charles leaves a note on his mother Queen Elizabeth's coffin
245.article_body: King Charles III left a handwritten note on his mother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral at the Westminster Abbey, which read, "In loving and devoted memory. Charles R". The "R" in King Charles' title refers to "Rex," which means king in Latin. The wreath on the coffin included flowers cut from Buckingham Palace, Clarence House and Highgrove House.

246.title: Missed 'Dil Chahta Hai': Isha Koppikar on her biggest mistake in B'wood
246.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar, when asked to share the biggest mistake she made in her Bollywood career, said that she "missed" Aamir Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna-starrer 'Dil Chahta Hai'. She revealed that she was offered the role opposite Saif, which was eventually played by Sonali Kulkarni. "I [already] gave my dates to Pyaar Ishq Aur Mohabbat," said Isha.

247.title: Told Shoaib Malik to retire; knew that he'll not be respected: Hafeez
247.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that all-rounder Shoaib Malik "gave his best" to the country for "about 21-22 years". "When I took my retirement, I told Malik to take retirement as well because I knew that he will not be respected," Hafeez said. Notably, 40-year-old Malik was overlooked by the selectors for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia.

248.title: Federer arrives in London for his final ATP tournament Laver Cup
248.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has arrived in London for his final ATP tournament, the Laver Cup. The 41-year-old recently announced that he will retire after the Laver Cup, scheduled to be held from September 23 to 25. Federer will play for Team Europe, which includes Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray, among others.

249.title: Mumbai Police ban cattle transportation stating lumpy skin disease
249.article_body: The Mumbai Police has prohibited the transportation of cattle in the city to prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease. Officials said the order, which came into effect on September 14, will remain in force till October 13. Other than cattle, transportation of fodder, grass or equipment which came in contact with lumpy skin disease-affected animals is also prohibited.

250.title: FTX may be operating in UK without authorisation: Britain's financial watchdog
250.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX may be offering financial services or products in the United Kingdom  without authorisation, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Friday. "This firm is not authorised by us and is targeting people in the UK," FCA said in a statement titled 'FTX'. Global rules are needed to regulate international crypto firms, FCA had said earlier.

251.title: Ghana declares end of Marburg virus outbreak
251.article_body: Ghanaian health authorities have declared the end of the recent Marburg virus outbreak that claimed three lives, Ghana's presidency informed on Monday. The outbreak of the highly infectious disease, which is similar to Ebola, was confirmed in July. This was the second Marburg virus outbreak in West Africa, following an outbreak in Guinea last year.

252.title: Told Ayan 'Won't do Brahmastra if it doesn't work for me': Nagarjuna
252.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna revealed filmmaker Ayan Mukerji offered him 'Brahmastra' in 2018. "When I was told Ayan wants me to play a role in his film, I said sure, but what am I going to be doing in a film like that? And I won't do it if it doesn't work for me," he stated. Nagarjuna played Anish Shetty in 'Brahmastra'.

253.title: I get things that are more 'maaro-todo', want something new: Sunny
253.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol, speaking about his image, said, "I wish they (filmmakers) would give me an opportunity to do something more than just scream." "I always want something new...but zyadatar (mostly) because of the commercial element, I get things that are more maaro-todo (hit and break)," he added. Sunny will be next seen in films like 'Chup' and 'Gadar 2'.

254.title: StartupXseed Ventures' Fund II closes at ₹243 crore
254.article_body: The second fund of early-stage venture capital firm StartupXseed Ventures was closed at ₹243 crore, oversubscribed by 20% compared to its initial target. StartupXseed was founded by BV Naidu (Former Director STPI) along with Mohandas Pai (through Aarin Capital), Ramakrishna V and Ravi Thakur. Fund II will invest between ₹5 - ₹12 crore in enterprise SaaS and deeptech startups.

255.title: Kidnappers pose as police to extort ₹11 lakh from B'luru real estate brokers
255.article_body: Five people allegedly kidnapped two real estate brokers from near the satellite bus stand on Mysuru Road in Bengaluru after posing as Telangana Police officers and extorted ₹11 lakh from them. The Bengaluru Police has arrested the accused. They kept the duo in a hotel room and asked for ₹50 lakh for letting them go.

256.title: 14-yr-old ends life after 'feeling rejected by female friend' in Mumbai
256.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 10 student died by suicide in Mumbai on Friday night after he felt rejected by a female friend, police said. The boy had chatted with a female friend who told him that they were just friends and that triggered the alleged suicide, Indian Express quoted police sources as saying. Police have registered a case of accidental death.

257.title: Can't rule out possibility of nuclear deal talks on UNGA sidelines: Iran
257.article_body: A meeting regarding the 2015 nuclear deal on the sidelines of this year's UN General Assembly is not entirely out of question, Iran's Foreign Ministry said on Monday. Tehran, however, dismissed the possibility of a bilateral meeting between Iranian and US officials. Iran is demanding the closure of an IAEA probe as a precondition for the pact's revival.

258.title: Pune city reports 39 cases of Swine Flu, 1 death in 7 days: Data
258.article_body: Pune Health Department has said the city has reported 39 cases of Swine Flu and one death due to the virus in the seven days between September 10-17. Dr Prachee Sathe from Ruby Hall Clinic said there're patients from all age groups who're admitted due to the disease. Pune has reported 909 Swine Flu cases and 40 deaths this year.

259.title: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joins BJP
259.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joined the Bharatiya Janata Party on Monday and merged his party, Punjab Lok Congress(PLC), with the BJP. Singh had floated Punjab Lok Congress after he had quit the Indian National Congress in 2021. He had earlier met BJP National President JP Nadda in Delhi.

260.title: Even if 'RRR' wins Oscar, won't change the way I work: SS Rajamouli
260.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli said his plans for his next film won't change even if he wins an Oscar for 'RRR' or not. "Oscar will be a real boost for morale for the (film's) unit...the country itself, but that's not going to change the way I work," he added. Rajamouli stated he wants to constantly keep upgrading himself as a filmmaker.

261.title: Ponting used to hit balls at 160 kmph speed with a cap on: Lee
261.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee narrated a 1994-95 incident about former skipper Ricky Ponting. "We had to face 12 balls at a 160 kmph off the bowling machine in the...nets," Lee said. "Well, the rumour is that...Ponting went there...with a cap on. Rod Marsh said 'what are you doing?' He said 'I'm batting'...Ponting goes bang...did not miss one," he added.

262.title: Yuvraj watches his 6 sixes in an over with son to mark 15th anniversary, shares video
262.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself and his seven-month-old son Orion watching his six sixes in an over. "Couldn’t have found a better partner to watch this together with after 15 years," Yuvraj wrote. Yuvraj slammed six sixes in an over off England's Stuart Broad in T20 World Cup on September 19, 2007.

263.title: Bombay HC denies bail to professor Hany Babu in Elgar Parishad case
263.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected the regular bail application of Delhi University professor and Elgar Parishad accused Hany Babu. Arrested in July 2020 from his home in Delhi, he is currently lodged in Mumbai's Taloja jail. The National Investigation Agency has accused Babu of a conspiracy to kill PM Narendra Modi, stating a letter was found on his computer.

264.title: Satellite spectrum auction will hinder rural broadband connectivity: Industry body chief
264.article_body: Telecom industry body ITU-APT Foundation of India (IAFI) President Bharat Bhatia said auctioning satellite spectrum will hinder growth of rural broadband connectivity in India. "If one operator buys [satellite spectrum], no one else can access and the satellite industry will not grow," Bhatia added. Allocating spectrum administratively rather than via auction is a better option, he further said.

265.title: Smart LED streetlights to be installed in every corner of Bengaluru
265.article_body: Bengaluru will see smart LED streetlights that are expected to reduce energy wastage as all sodium vapour lamps will be removed from the city streets. Eight zones will get the upgraded streetlights in another two months, officials said. As many as 4.85 lakh sodium vapour lamps will be replaced with LED lights.

266.title: We ran an experiment: YouTube after users claim watching 10 unskippable ads
266.article_body: A couple of months after some users claimed to see 10 unskippable advertisements during a single break, YouTube in a statement to 9to5Google confirmed that it ran a small experiment globally. YouTube said that it "served multiple ads in an ad pod when viewers watched longer videos on connected TVs". "We have concluded this small experiment," the company added.

267.title: Ranbir, Alia meet family of their bodyguard, latter calls it 'Family Astra'
267.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt recently met the family of their security consultant Yusuf Ibrahim. He took to his Instagram Stories to share photos of Alia and Ranbir as they posed with his family. Along with a photo, Yusuf wrote 'FamilyAstra' in reference to the couple's film 'Brahmastra', which was released on September 9.

268.title: SEBI invites EoIs for implementing new tool to boost social media surveillance
268.article_body: SEBI has invited expressions of interest (EoIs) to implement a 'Web Intelligence Tool' to boost surveillance of social media and other platforms. Publicly available data, a result of rising internet usage, has the potential to provide insights on topics related to various securities laws' violations, SEBI said. The tool should save time and gather unstructured, publicly available data, SEBI added.

269.title: Pimpri Chinchwad-based IT professional robbed, beaten up by 2 men
269.article_body: A 47-year-old Pimpri-Chinchwad-based IT professional was waylaid and robbed by two men on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway, police said. The victim was returning home when the accused started arguing with him, robbed him and beat him up. They hatched a fake accident plan and pretended that their mobile was broken in the incident, hence threatening and extorting money from the victim.

270.title: Delhi sees rise in dengue cases, reports 101 new infections last week
270.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 101 people were diagnosed with the infection in the last week alone. Delhi has reported 152 dengue cases so far in September, taking the national capital's total tally to nearly 400 so far this year, a report said. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

271.title: Kohli changed the focus of Team India when he became captain: Johnson
271.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Mitchell Johnson said that batter Virat Kohli changed the focus of the Indian team when he took on the captaincy. Kohli was named as India's all-format captain in 2017. Rohit Sharma replaced Kohli as limited-overs captain in December last year and as full-time Test captain in February this year.

272.title: 9 persons sentenced to life imprisonment in 11-yr-old Rohtak murder case
272.article_body: A local court in Haryana's Rohtak sentenced nine persons to life imprisonment in an 11-year-old murder case. They were convicted of killing a man, a resident of Rohtak and the court also fined each convict ₹20,000. On August 2, 2011, the man was killed with sticks and bricks, Sampla Police Station in-charge Rakesh Saini said.

273.title: Roma coach Jose Mourinho restrained, sent off after charging at referee
273.article_body: AS Roma manager Jose Mourinho was sent off during his team's match against Atalanta after he invaded the pitch to confront the referee. Mourinho had to be restrained by his own coaching staff and Serie A officials after Roma was not awarded a penalty. In February 2022, Mourinho was banned for two games after he acted in a "threatening" manner.

274.title: SEBI seeks details of PE, VC funds with 5 or less investors: Report
274.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked venture capital (VC) and private equity (PE) funds with five or fewer investors to disclose certain details, The Economic Times reported. This includes the investors' names, amount committed and funds raised. The market regulator also requested for details of investee companies, their countries of origin and nature of their business.

275.title: Tharoor meets Sonia Gandhi after endorsing 'constructive reforms' petition
275.article_body: Hours after endorsing a petition by younger members of the party seeking 'constructive reforms' in the Congress, MP Shashi Tharoor met UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi in Delhi today. "I welcome this petition that is being circulated by a group of young Congress members...It has gathered over 650 signatures so far. I am happy to endorse it," he said.

276.title: India gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia: Report
276.article_body: India reportedly gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia since the Ukraine conflict began in February. As per a report, India has emerged as the second-largest buyer of Russian oil after China. Russian oil accounts for 12% of the country's total oil purchase as compared to less than 1% before the war.

277.title: When a film premieres at TIFF, it's also taken seriously in India: Radhika
277.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan, who recently attended the premiere of her film 'Kacchey Limbu' at Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF), said that when a film is premiered on a platform like TIFF, it is also taken seriously in India. "It is not just another film," she added. Radhika further said 'Kacchey Limbu' addresses a very important topic.

278.title: Gambhir urges Indians to end hero worship, says 'Don't create monsters in dressing room'
278.article_body: Gautam Gambhir has urged Indians to end hero worship in cricket. "Don't create monsters in dressing room," he said. Gambhir noted when Virat Kohli slammed his 71st international hundred, Indians ignored Bhuvneshwar Kumar's five-wicket contribution in that match. He stated only Kapil Dev and MS Dhoni are credited for India's World Cup victories, adding, "We never bother about small contributions."

279.title: I'm a Balki fan now, 'Chup' is his best film: Mahesh Bhatt
279.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt shared Mahesh Bhatt's review of her upcoming film 'Chup'. As per the post, Mahesh Bhatt called 'Chup' a film that "has audacity and stands tall all alone". She mentioned that the filmmaker is now a fan of R Balki and called 'Chup' "his best film". The R Balki directorial also stars Sunny Deol and Dulquer Salmaan.

280.title: 71 international tons, that's ridiculous: Finch on Kohli ahead of 1st T20I
280.article_body: Ahead of India-Australia first T20I, Australia skipper Aaron Finch said it'll take a very brave man to write India batter Virat Kohli off. "At any stage, he has shown for 15 years now that he's one of the greatest players of all time...He's super and has 71 international centuries. That's just ridiculous," he added. Match will be played on Tuesday.

281.title: J&K Congress set to pass resolution to appoint Rahul as party President
281.article_body: Ahead of the party's presidential election, the J&K Pradesh Congress Committee is set to pass a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as party chief again. The Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu and Bihar units of the party have already passed the resolutions backing the Wayanad MP. The election for the crucial post will be held on October 17.

282.title: Repair 221 potholes on major roads within 10 days: HC to BBMP
282.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has been ordered by the Karnataka HC to repair 221 potholes on major roads within 10 days. The HC noted that citizens have a right to have roads without potholes and BBMP is obliged to provide better roads. BBMP also informed the HC that it has removed 2,024 out of 2,626 encroachments on stormwater drains.

283.title: Man loses 8 fingers during machine work in Gurugram, says 'Had no training'
283.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly lost eight fingers of his hands while working on a power press machine in Gurugram. He said that he had told the supervisor that he did not know how to operate the machine. "I...had no training in how to operate the machine...The supervisor said...there was shortage of operators and threatened to fire me," the victim added.

284.title: Mitchell Johnson encounters snake in his hotel room in Lucknow, shares pics
284.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson, who is currently in India for the Legends League Cricket 2022, took to Instagram to reveal that he encountered a snake in his hotel room in Lucknow. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "Anyone know what type of snake this is?" In another post, he wrote, "Interesting stay so far in Lucknow."

285.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann deplaned in Germany for being drunk, claim reports; AAP denies
285.article_body: After reports claimed that Punjab's Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann was deplaned at Frankfurt airport on Saturday night because he was drunk, the Aam Aadmi Party has denied these allegations. "The dirty tricks department of our political opponents are spreading these canards to defame our CM," AAP said. Other reports said that Mann skipped his scheduled flight as he was unwell.

286.title: OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal's salary rises 250% to ₹5.6 crore in FY22
286.article_body: Ritesh Agarwal, Founder and Group CEO of OYO, received a remuneration of ₹5.6 crore in FY22, up 250% from ₹1.6 crore in the previous year. Notably, the 28-year-old's compensation stood at ₹21.5 lakh in FY20. In a filing with SEBI, OYO said its ESOP expenses rose 344% to ₹680 crore in FY22, while salary and bonus expenses fell by 27%.

287.title: Planning to shoot part 2 and 3 together: Ranbir Kapoor on ‘Brahmastra’
287.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said the makers of 'Brahmastra' are planning to shoot the remaining parts of the film's trilogy together. "Our plan as a team is to shoot both part 2 and part 3 together so that we don't delay the films and they can be out in theatres as per the schedule," he said. 'Brahmastra' is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

288.title: It has to be a visual spectacle: Nagarjuna on his 100th film
288.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna said his 100th career film has to be a visual spectacle to bring people to theatres. "Doesn't have to be a 'Brahmastra' or VFX (heavy film), but larger than life is what I feel is bringing people to the theatres in big numbers," he added. Nagarjuna revealed that his 100th film is being written by four filmmakers.

289.title: Judicial custody of Sanjay Raut extended by 14 days in Patra Chawl case
289.article_body: A special PMLA court extended Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s judicial custody by 14 days in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The court will hear his bail petition on September 21. He was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore land scam case.

290.title: Pune Police arrest 19-yr-old boy, detain minor accomplice for arson
290.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 19-year-old boy and detained his minor accomplice for allegedly setting fire to four bikes and two cars in the parking lot of a residential building. Officials said that the suspects had a dispute with the residents during the Ganesh festival over the contribution to the celebrations. An FIR was registered at Sinhagad Road Police Station.

291.title: Ready for talks on prisoner swap but US not complying: Russia
291.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry said that it is ready for talks on a prisoner exchange to release US citizens jailed in Russia, but the American embassy in Moscow is "not fulfilling its official duties" to maintain dialogue. The prison exchange could include US Marine Corps veteran Paul Whelan, basketball player Brittney Griner and Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

292.title: Before Aishwarya, wanted to cast Rekha in 'Ponniyin Selvan’: Mani Ratnam
292.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam has said he wanted to cast actress Rekha for the role of Nandini in his film 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One'. The role eventually went to Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. "Before Aishwarya, I wanted to work with Rekha for the same character. Didn't have any other actors in mind for this role," the director said at an event.

293.title: Cat population rises in Mumbai, BMC allocates ₹1 cr for sterilisation
293.article_body: The population of cats is on rise in several parts of Mumbai and the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to control the birth of cats by sterilising them. The civic body has allocated ₹1 crore for sterilisation project and urged NGOs to help them. "We are getting lots of complaints from citizens regarding cat menace," a BMC official said.

294.title: Cong's DK Shivakumar appears before ED in Delhi in money laundering case
294.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Monday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in Delhi for questioning in a money laundering case. Earlier, party leader Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Narendra Modi, alleging that it was part of his tactics to derail the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "But he won't succeed," Jairam had tweeted.

295.title: Amarinder Singh's decision to join BJP won't be appreciated by people: Cong MP
295.article_body: Ahead of Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder Singh joining BJP, Congress MP Deepender Hooda on Monday said, "I believe this is a wrong decision taken by…Singh." Furthermore, he said, "Right after the farmers' protest, his decision of joining the BJP will not be appreciated by the people...There is no conflict among the leaders of the Haryana Congress."

296.title: TSRTC starts bus service from Hitech City to Hyderabad Airport
296.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) announced a bus service from Shilparamam at HITECH City to Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The bus will be leaving Shilparamam every 30 minutes between 4:30 am and 10:30 pm daily. As per TSRTC's release, a 10 per cent discount will be provided for those who commute every day on the route.

297.title: 32-year-old graphic designer dies by suicide in Pune
297.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who worked as a graphic designer, has died by suicide in Pune. The victim, a resident of Raikar Mala, Dhayari, lived with his girlfriend but was alone at the time of the incident. Shailesh Sankhe, senior police inspector at Sinhagad, said that initial findings stated it was a case of suicide, but all angles are being probed.

298.title: 2 killed as typhoon Nanmadol hits Japan, PM delays departure to NY
298.article_body: At least two people were killed, 87 were injured and one went missing as typhoon Nanmadol triggered winds and record rainfall in western Japan on Monday leading to transport disruption. According to the trade ministry, about 3,40,000 households in Kyushu were without electricity. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida delayed his departure to New York to attend the UN General Assembly.

299.title: Uttarakhand man swept away while trying to cross swollen river; video surfaces
299.article_body: A video has surfaced online that shows a man being washed away while trying to cross a heavy flowing river in Uttarakhand's Fatehpur area. The man is missing and a search operation is currently underway. The video shows the man attempting to cross the river on foot, while some people were standing on the road.

300.title: No skin-to-skin contact with foreigners: Chinese official to locals over monkeypox
300.article_body: A top Chinese health official told locals, "To prevent possible monkeypox infection and as part of our healthy lifestyle, it is recommended that you do not have direct skin-to-skin contact with foreigners." The advice comes after the first known case of monkeypox in mainland China was reported. The monkeypox case was reported in an individual who arrived from abroad.

301.title: 14-yr-old boy who went missing tells Delhi Police, 'I was going to meet PM'
301.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, who went missing in Delhi, told police on being found that he was going to meet PM Narendra Modi. When police tried to enquire from him, he couldn't tell about his parents and address. Police later traced out his parents and handed him over to them. The boy's father said that he was having an unsound mind.

302.title: 1 arrested for cow slaughter after shootout in Greater Noida
302.article_body: Following a late-night exchange of fire with police personnel in Fatehpur Atta village of Greater Noida, one person was arrested for alleged cow slaughter. According to the police, remains of a cow and a country-made pistol with a live cartridge, among others, have been recovered. The three other associates of the accused, Taju, managed to run away, police said.

303.title: DotPe raises $58 million in Series B round led by Temasek
303.article_body: DotPe, an offline-to-online commerce platform for businesses, has raised $58 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Temasek and saw participation from existing investors PayU and InfoEdge Ventures, along with new investors Mitsubishi and Naya Capital. DotPe was founded in 2020 by former PayU executives Shailaz Nag, Gyanesh Sharma and Anurag Gupta.

304.title: 50 people sentenced to death by Gujarat trial courts in 8 months of 2022
304.article_body: Gujarat trial courts have sentenced 50 people to death in eight months of 2022. In February 2022, a special court had sentenced 38 convicts to death in connection with the 2008 Ahmedabad serial blast case. Trial courts also sentenced convicts to death in cases of rape and murder of minors, reports said.

305.title: Gaza farmer finds Byzantine era mosaic while trying to plant trees
305.article_body: A Palestinian farmer in Gaza discovered a mosaic from the Byzantine era while he was trying to plant more trees on his land. The farmer called the discovery a "treasure" and said, "It belongs to every Palestinian." The mosaic panels of the flooring depict animals and other features of social life during Byzantine era, Palestine's Tourism and Antiquities Ministry said.

306.title: Around 6 lakh consumers opt for power subsidy in Delhi in first 3 days
306.article_body: The Delhi government's official data shows that around six lakh electricity consumers have applied for electricity subsidy scheme in the first three days. As per the new policy, the automatic subsidy on electricity consumed up to 200 and 400 units will end from October 1 and only those who opt for it by September end will be eligible for subsidy.

307.title: China lodges 'stern representations' over Biden's Taiwan remark
307.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry on Monday lodged "stern representations" over US President Joe Biden saying that the US forces will defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion. The ministry's spokesperson said that China reserves the right to take action against activities that split the nation and urged the US to not send "wrong signals" to Taiwan independence separatist forces.

308.title: My 'Player of the Match' award is dedicated to Jhulan: Smriti on 1st ODI win
308.article_body: After India Women's seven-wicket win against England Women in first ODI, India opener Smriti Mandhana dedicated her 'Player of the Match' award to teammate Jhulan Goswami, who'll be retiring from international cricket after the ongoing series. "The way she bowled was amazing. Whatever the Indian team is gonna do in this series will be for Jhulu di [Jhulan]," she added.

309.title: BJP showed a malicious attitude towards the Opposition: Mayawati
309.article_body: BSP President Mayawati criticised the BJP for branding the Opposition as "jobless" and said that the party showed a malicious attitude towards the Opposition. "BJP’s claim that the Opposition is unemployed exposes their arrogant thinking and irresponsible attitude. The thinking of the government should be to prove honesty and loyalty towards the public interest and public welfare," said Mayawati.

310.title: AAP govt in Punjab to conduct floor test on Sept 22 amid 'Operation Lotus' claims
310.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has called a special Assembly session on September 22 to seek a trust vote amid AAP MLAs' claims of 'Operation Lotus' in the state. Last week, state Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema alleged that BJP contacted some 7 to 10 of its MLAs. He added BJP offered them up to ₹25 crore each to switch sides.

311.title: Pic of Anil Kapoor's American lookalike John Effer goes viral
311.article_body: A picture of John Effer, an American bodybuilder, has gone viral, with several social media users calling him Anil Kapoor's lookalike. Effer also shared a picture of himself alongside Anil's photograph on Instagram, writing, "I am waiting on that Bollywood call to be honest." "I literally thought you were Anil Kapoor," an Instagram user wrote. "Swole-nil Kapoor," another user joked.

312.title: Horses leading Queen's procession in London trained to hear 'sobbing' sounds
312.article_body: The horses leading Queen Elizabeth's coffin procession on Monday have undergone special training wherein crying soldiers threw flowers at them during rehearsals in order to make them familiar with the sound of 'sobbing'. The four horses chosen to lead the procession will guide a total of 199 military equines and were gifted to her by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

313.title: I did 80 auditions before I hacked my first ad: Actress Nimrat Kaur
313.article_body: Nimrat Kaur, speaking about her beginning days as an actress, said, "I did 80 auditions before I hacked my first advertisement...that is a lot of heartbreak." The actress revealed that she was set to feature alongside a top star in a film, however, the film was shelved. "I don't know if it's happening ever...it really broke my heart," she added.

314.title: ED has summoned Delhi AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak: Manish Sisodia
314.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday claimed that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak in connection with its probe into the excise policy scam. "What does our MCD poll in-charge have to do with the Delhi government's excise policy? Is their target liquor policy or MCD polls?" Sisodia said in a tweet.

315.title: Russia may have lost 4 combat jets in Ukraine in last 10 days: UK
315.article_body: The British Defence Ministry has said it is likely that Russia lost at least four combat jets in Ukraine within the last 10 days, taking its attrition to approximately 55 since the invasion began. The UK military added that losses are possibly result of Russian Air Force attempting to provide air support to ground forces under pressure from Ukraine's advances.

316.title: World's highest battlefield Siachen Glacier gets satellite-based internet service
316.article_body: The Indian Army's Fire and Fury Corps took to Twitter to announce that Siachen Signallers activated satellite-based internet service on the the world's highest battlefield, Siachen Glacier, at a height of 19,061 feet. The internet is being provided by Bharat Broadband Network Limited (BBNL). The Fire and Fury Corps also tweeted pictures of the equipment being installed.

317.title: What flag and crown are on the Queen's coffin?
317.article_body: The coffin of Queen Elizabeth II has been draped by a flag called Royal Standard, which represents the Sovereign and the United Kingdom. It's split into four quarterings, with the colours red, yellow and blue. Each quartering represents a country in UK, excluding Wales. The crown lying atop Queen's coffin is Imperial State Crown, encrusted with more than 3,000 gemstones.

318.title: Russian 'torture chambers' found across Kharkiv region: Zelenskyy
318.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed that over 10 "torture chambers" used by Russian forces to abuse detainees have been found across the Kharkiv region following Ukraine's recent retrieval of territory. Documents confirming the functioning of a so-called police force responsible for running one such "torture chamber" have been seized, Kharkiv's prosecutor's office said.

319.title: He shows sporting class again: Anurag on Bajrang's bronze at World C'ships
319.article_body: Congratulating Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia after his bronze medal win at World Wrestling Championships in Belgrade, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "Bajrang Punia shows his sporting class again!!" The 28-year-old Olympic bronze medallist became the first Indian to win four medals in the tournament. Bajrang beat Puerto Rico's Sebastian C Rivera 11-9 in 65-kg category.

320.title: Man gets violent, tries to break window of Pakistani flight mid-air; video surfaces
320.article_body: A video doing rounds on social media showed a violent male passenger arguing with the crew of a Peshawar-Dubai Pakistan International Airlines flight and trying to break one of its windows mid-air. The crew members alleged the man created a ruckus inside the airplane and lied down on the aisle. According to reports, the passenger was blacklisted by the airline.

321.title: 2 arrested for selling fake degrees, certificates in Noida
321.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested two suspects for allegedly making and selling fake degrees and certificates from Sector 58 area of Noida. The accused, Anand Shekhar and Chirag Sharma, used to run their illegal operations in Bengaluru before moving to Noida a few months ago, police said. The accused used to lure their victims with the help of Google advertisements.

322.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral begins at Westminster Abbey
322.article_body: Britain's longest-serving monarch Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral service has begun at Westminster Abbey in London. Prior to the funeral, a tenor bell at the abbey tolled 96 times, once for each year of the Queen's life. Notably, world leaders including President of India Droupadi Murmu, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron are attending the Queen's funeral.

323.title: Statue of Unity of no use, ₹3,000 cr should’ve been used for tribals: BTP leader
323.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party leader Chhotubhai Vasava said the Statue of Unity "has been of no use". On being asked, BJP has cited the Statue of Unity as one of its development projects in tribal areas for employment generation, Vasava said, "They spent ₹3,000 crore on the statue. They should have spent that money on development of tribal areas."

324.title: Gurugram civic body's enforcement team thrashed by multiple people
324.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram's enforcement team was allegedly attacked by unidentified suspects near the city's Mahavir Chowk. One official was thrashed by multiple people while another was hit by a stone, officials said. Notably, the incident happened when the enforcement team had gone to move about 40 illegal street vendors to a newly set up vending zone.

325.title: ‘Beyond The Star’ docu-series on Salman to release on his b'day: Report
325.article_body: 'Beyond The Star', the docu-series on Salman Khan, will reportedly release on December 27, which also happens to be the actor's birthday. As per reports, 'Beyond The Star' will see Salman's family, friends, co-stars and directors sharing their opinions on the actor. The docu-series, which is co-produced by Salman, will reportedly also show never-seen-before pictures and videos from his childhood.

326.title: Parts of B'luru to face power cuts on Sept 21 & 23 from 10 am-5 pm
326.article_body: Some parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts on September 21 and 23 between 10:00 am and 5:00 pm due to repair and maintenance work being undertaken by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). Areas like Veerabhadra Nagar, Hanumantha Nagar and Pramod Layout will be affected on September 21. Bairohalli, Ramohalli and Kengeri Town will be affected on September 23.

327.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia 'cheerful' after first meal in India: Officials
327.article_body: The eight cheetahs brought to India from Nambia on Saturday had their first meal in India at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on Sunday evening and appeared cheerful and in good spirits, according to the park's officials. Each of the eight cheetahs was served two kilograms of buffalo meat. One of them ate less, but it's not concerning, officials added.

328.title: Eager to get house after dad's death, Delhi man kills brother with scissors
328.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his 21-year-old brother to death with a pair of scissors over property dispute in Delhi. The accused was upset after his father, who died of COVID-19, left his house in his wife's name. "He [accused] fought with his family...as he wanted it [house] to be registered under his name," police said.

329.title: Will use some of them: Ayan on fan theories around 'Brahmastra' trilogy
329.article_body: Celebrating Brahmastra's box office success, director Ayan Mukerji shared that the makers are "absorbing and learning" from audiences' feedback. He appreciated "amazing fan theories" around the upcoming films in the 'Brahmastra' trilogy and said he's "definitely going to use" some of them. Ayan also shared that he has started work on 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev & The Astraverse'.

330.title: Dhanush shares his look from 'Captain Miller', fans react
330.article_body: Dhanush took to Instagram to share a post revealing his look from the upcoming Tamil film 'Captain Miller'. Several fans reacted to his look with comments like "super", "can't wait" and "killing it". Arun Matheswaran, the filmmaker who is helming the film, also shared Dhanush's look on his Instagram Stories with the caption, "Killer Killer, Captain Miller!!"

331.title: Mumbai youth booked under Arms Act for cutting b'day cakes with sword
331.article_body: Police have booked a 17-year-old youth under Arms Act for cutting birthday cakes with a sword in Mumbai. A video of the act has gone viral on social media, showing the youth cutting at least 21 cakes with a sword in his hand, while his friends cheer for him during the party. Police said the video is from Borivali area.

332.title: Told bank I don't need loan anymore: Auto driver who won ₹25 cr lottery
332.article_body: An autorickshaw driver in Kerala, who won ₹25 crore lottery just a day after his application for ₹3 lakh loan (to go to Malaysia to work as a chef) was approved, said that he had told the bank that he doesn’t need the loan anymore. Lottery winner Anoop said that he will start something in the hotel field in Kerala.

333.title: ED attaches ₹48-cr assets belonging to ex-Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, his aide
333.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday attached assets worth ₹48 crore "beneficially owned" by former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection with the teacher recruitment scam. The attached properties include flats, a farmhouse and prime land in Kolkata. With this, the total attachment in the case stands at ₹103.10 crore.

334.title: Man burnt alive after truck catches fire in J&K's Kathua
334.article_body: A man burnt to death after the truck he was travelling in caught fire on Jammu-Pathankot national highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The victim was the truck driver's helper and his identity is yet to be ascertained, police said. A fire tender reached the spot and controlled the fire, but it was too late to save the man.

335.title: Actress Kate Winslet rushed to hospital after slipping on her film set
335.article_body: Hollywood actress Kate Winslet was rushed to a hospital in Croatia after she slipped on the set of her film 'Lee', her representative said. "Kate...was taken to hospital as a precautionary measure required by the production. She is fine and will be filming, as planned, this week," the representative stated. The film is a biopic of Lee Miller, the model-turned-photographer.

336.title: 2 couples killed in accident after attending condolence meet in Rajasthan
336.article_body: Two couples travelling on a motorcycle and a scooty in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district were killed on Sunday when a car rammed into the vehicles from behind and overturned. The car driver left his vehicle behind and fled the spot. The deceased were travelling to Narnaul in Haryana after attending a condolence meeting near Singhana, police said.

337.title: Fake accounting: Mohandas Pai as OYO claims first EBITDA positive quarter
337.article_body: TV Mohandas Pai, the former CFO of Infosys, accused OYO of "fake accounting" after the startup claimed it turned EBITDA positive for the first time in the first quarter of FY23, with an adjusted EBITDA of ₹7.3 crore. "There is nothing like...adjusted EBITDA. They are trying to mislead investors...Regulators and stock exchanges should stop such misreporting in India," Pai tweeted.

338.title: Haven’t planned but definitely look forward to being a mother: Gauahar
338.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan said she is looking forward to being a mother. "I definitely look forward to being a mother. I really hope that happens soon," she said, adding that she hasn't planned for it because she believes it will happen when it's ought to happen. She added she hasn't even had any such conversation with her husband Zaid Darbar.

339.title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra plays football wearing saree, shares pics
339.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra on Monday shared pictures of her playing football in a saree at the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. In the pictures, Moitra can be seen wearing sports shoes and a pair of sunglasses. She wrote alongside, "Fun moments from the final of the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. And yes, I play in a saree."

340.title: Some iPhone 14 Pro users face camera shaking, rattling on using Instagram, TikTok
340.article_body: Some users are reportedly facing an issue with iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max cameras. Users took to social media to share visuals of the camera shaking and making a rattling noise when using a third-party app like Instagram, Snapchat or TikTok. As per a report, this may be an issue with the third-party app software rather than Apple's hardware.

341.title: Made to feel like a living, elastic bubble: Apple iPhone's 'dynamic island' designer
341.article_body: Chan Karunamuni, the Human Interface Designer at Apple who designed the latest iPhone's 'dynamic island', tweeted, "Its goal is to feel like a living, elastic bubble that can fluidly shapeshift into different alerts and experiences." 'Dynamic Island' is a pill-shaped cutout at the top of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max. It can display an array of notifications.

342.title: It blew us away: James Cameron on remastered version of 'Avatar'
342.article_body: Director James Cameron said his 2009 film 'Avatar', which is re-releasing at theatres, is looking "better than it ever looked". "We just watched the film recently when we finished the whole remastering process, and it kinda blew us away," he said about the film, which has been remastered in 4K. 'Avatar' is scheduled to re-release on September 23.

343.title: Bangladeshi clerics violate visa norms: Assam govt writes to Centre
343.article_body: Assam government has written to Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) about Bangladeshi clerics violating the norms of their tourist visas by indulging in religious activities. This comes a day after 17 Bangladesh nationals were arrested from Biswanath district for indulging in religious activities. DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said many Bangladeshi clerics have been barred from entering Assam.

344.title: Hyd student invests education loan money into share market; missing
344.article_body: An engineering student in Hyderabad went missing after investing educational loan amount into share market. The student had taken ₹1 lakh from his parents and ₹1.10 lakh education loan from SBI to pay fees. When the boy's parents asked him the reason behind not paying fees, the boy said he had lent it to a friend and later went missing.

345.title: 24-year-old engineering student drowns in private pool in Hyderabad
345.article_body: A 24-year-old engineering student drowned in a private swimming pool in Hyderabad on Sunday, police said. Following the incident, the deceased's family claimed that there was negligence by the pool's management and demanded that action should be taken against them. The deceased had been out with his friends to play cricket and then had gone to the pool, officers added.

346.title: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Doctor G' to release on October 14
346.article_body:
Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Monday announced the release date of his upcoming film, 
'Doctor G'. Sharing a couple of posters on his Instagram account, Ayushmann wrote that his film, which also stars Rakul Preet Singh, will release on October 14. Earlier in a statement, Ayushmann said, "It's an honour to portray a doctor on the screen for the first time."

347.title: Bitcoin falls below $19,000 to 3-month low
347.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell about 5% to a three-month low of $18,387 on Monday. Ether dropped 3% to a two-month low of $1,285 and is down more than 10% in the last 24 hours. Dogecoin, which currently stands as the world's 10th largest cryptocurrency, has fallen 8.11% in the last 24 hours, CoinMarketCap data showed.

348.title: Truth & justice will win: AAP MP on Chandigarh University issue
348.article_body: Speaking about the Chandigarh University video leak incident, AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday said that truth and justice will win. "Our senior police officials are present at the spot. Strict actions will be taken against the accused," Chadha added. "This is a serious and sensitive issue. The Punjab government is standing with the students," he stated.

349.title: Instagram rewards Jaipur student with ₹38 lakh for finding a bug
349.article_body: Neeraj Sharma, a student from Rajasthan's Jaipur, has been rewarded ₹38 lakh by Instagram for reporting a bug. "There was a bug in Facebook's Instagram, through which the thumbnail of the reel could have been changed from any account," reports quoted Sharma as saying. He shared a demo of the bug with Facebook and his report was approved.

350.title: Parineeti announces her next film 'Tiranga', to release on Oct 14
350.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra on Monday announced her upcoming Ribhu Dasgupta directorial, titled 'Code Name: Tiranga'. The espionage action thriller, which will release on October 14, will see Parineeti play a RAW agent. "I hope the audiences enjoy this action entertainer which talks about a soldier's sacrifice in the line of duty for her nation," the director said in a statement.
