351.title: Russia attacked Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear plant, reactors not damaged: Ukraine
351.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear company Energoatom said Russian troops struck the Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear power plant in Mykolaiv region on Monday. The blast that took place 300 metres away from the reactors, damaged a nearby hydroelectric power plant and transmission lines but all three power units remained functional. Ukraine's Mykolaiv region has been facing rocket attacks by Russian forces in recent weeks.

352.title: 29-year-old actress Deepa found dead at her Chennai apartment, letter recovered
352.article_body: Actress Deepa, also known as Pauline Jessica, was found dead in her apartment in Chennai, following which police filed a case and recovered a letter from her home. A police official said that the 29-year-old's family members had sent her friend Prabhakaran to check on her after she didn't respond to their calls. Prabhakaran found her dead and alerted them.

353.title: Ola fires 200 engineers to 'minimise redundancy'
353.article_body: Ola has confirmed that it is laying off some employees after a report claimed that the company was planning to fire at least 500 employees across software teams. Ola, however, said only about 200 engineers, including some in the software vertical, have been asked to go. Ola said it is "centralising operations and undertaking a restructuring exercise to minimise redundancy".

354.title: Amarinder Singh meets JP Nadda ahead of joining BJP
354.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh met BJP National President JP Nadda in the national capital ahead of joining the party. “Amarinder Singh is also likely to merge his PLC party with the BJP,” PLC spokesperson Pritpal Singh said. Former CM made the announcement of joining the BJP after he met the Union Home Minister Amit Shah on September 12.

355.title: Rahul Gandhi speaks to Kerala fishermen during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
355.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi interacted with fishermen about their plights at Vadackal beach in Kerala's Alappuzha during the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra." He discussed a variety of topics, including the rising cost of fuel, decreasing subsidies, dwindling fish stocks, and inadequate opportunities. The yatra is in its Kerala leg and will reach Karnataka on September 30.

356.title: Jitendra Singh to take part in Global Clean Energy Action Forum
356.article_body: Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh will lead an Indian delegation at the Global Clean Energy Action Forum this week in the US. Ministers from over 30 countries will participate in the event to discuss ways of accelerating clean energy innovation and deployment. He is likely to talk about India's commitment to a low-carbon future.

357.title: OYO's FY22 revenue rises to ₹4,905 cr, loss narrows to ₹1,851 cr
357.article_body: Travel-tech company OYO filed financial documents with SEBI stating that its revenue rose 18% to ₹4,905 crore in FY22 from the previous year, while net loss narrowed 45% to ₹1,851 crore. OYO clocked EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation) profit of ₹10.6 crore for June quarter. The company is behind pre-COVID annual revenue of ₹13,413 crore in FY20.

358.title: Chandigarh University is based in Punjab: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher on 'video leak' case
358.article_body: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher has said she is "morally shaken by the ghastly incident" at Chandigarh University. She tweeted, "The name of my city is being tarnished...I want to clarify that it is based in Kharar, Punjab." It comes after alleged leak of videos of girls taking baths, however, police said they found a video of the accused girl herself.

359.title: 28-year-old Indian student dies after being shot in Canada
359.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian student, Satwinder Singh, has succumbed to the injuries sustained during a shooting in Canada's Ontario last week that also claimed two other lives, police said. The gunman identified as 40-year-old Sean Petrie was shot dead by police. A fundraiser was started to support his parents and send his body back to India.

360.title: US broke promises on nuclear deal, we need guarantee: Iranian President
360.article_body: Tehran would be serious about reviving the nuclear deal if the US guarantees not to withdraw from it, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi told CBS. Raisi said that Iran would be serious about the deal if it is fair but Americans could not be trusted. Tehran wants the UN nuclear watchdog to close probe into uranium traces found at undeclared sites.

361.title: Samajwadi Party's march against BJP stopped, police say 'No permission taken'
361.article_body: Samajwadi Party's march against Bharatiya Janata Party was stopped midway in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said the march was stopped because "the government was afraid of answering questions". Police said the protestors had not taken any permission. "They were assigned designated route which wouldn't have caused traffic congestion. They refused to take that," police added.

362.title: FedEx to close 90 office locations, pause hiring amid decline in global demand
362.article_body: FedEx has said it would be closing 90 office locations, five corporate offices and delaying new hiring amid a decline in its global package delivery business. FedEx Ground's revenue fell about $300 million below company forecasts. This segment handles e-commerce deliveries in the US. On Friday, FedEx shares plunged 21.2%, marking its biggest one-day drop in more than 40 years.

363.title: 3 of family dead after roof collapses in UP's Deoria amid heavy rains
363.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after the roof of a two-storey building collapsed and trapped them in early hours of Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria. The building was reportedly vulnerable and decayed. UP has witnessed several casualties due to wall collapse over incessant rainfall. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath had announced ₹4 lakh compensation for the families of deceased.

364.title: Makers need to understand that it's getting predictable: Tisca on B'wood
364.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said many Bollywood films are failing to perform at the box office because they are "getting predictable and repetitive". She said the makers "constantly look at things from a commercial point of view", which needs to change. She added if the makers put "more energy and emphasis" on writing, Bollywood will have "far better and fresher content".

365.title: BMC to set up its first pet cremation incinerator in Malad in 2 months
365.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up a pet incinerator at cow and dog pound in Evershine Nagar, Malad, which will be operational in about two months. The price for pet cremation is yet to be decided, however, stray animals can be cremated free of cost, said reports. It will be an odourless and pollution-free process, said the official.

366.title: Body of electrician found 2 days after being swept away in Maha creek
366.article_body: The body of an electrician, who was swept away in the strong water current of Kamba Creek near Maharashtra's Bhiwandi amid heavy rainfall, was recovered on Sunday evening. The deceased and his colleague had gone to the spot to fix an electrical issue on Friday. His video of holding himself on high-tension wires trying to save himself had gone viral.

367.title: Charity rescues 372 people trying to cross Mediterranean; 1 dead
367.article_body: A Spanish charity, Open Arms, has recovered the body of one man and rescued 372 people on board unseaworthy smugglers' boats who were trying to cross the central Mediterranean to enter Europe, officials said on Sunday. The deceased was shot dead by smugglers. "The smugglers forced the people to take the corpse with them," a spokesperson of the charity said.

368.title: He's one of the most nuanced actors I've witnessed: R Balki on Dulquer
368.article_body: Director R Balki said he's been observing Dulquer Salmaan's filmography and finds his taste in films "outstanding". He called Dulquer "one of the most nuanced actors" in Indian cinema, and said he's glad the actor liked the script of 'Chup' and agreed to do the film. "I thought a role like this needed someone like him," he added.

369.title: Thousands camp to get best spots to view Queen's funeral; pics surface
369.article_body: Pictures of thousands of people camping overnight in London to get the best spots to view the funeral procession of Queen Elizabeth II have surfaced online. "This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of history," a 60-year-old woman who camped in a tent with her two daughters and grandchildren said. Some people were also seen sleeping on the ground.

370.title: Pak will absolutely not default on debts despite floods: Minister
370.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Miftah Ismail told Reuters on Sunday that the country will "absolutely not" default on its debt obligations despite the floods which have affected 33 million citizens. He added that while the path to stability "has become narrower", the country won't default if it continues to take "prudent decisions". Most stabilisation policies are on track, he further said.

371.title: All-women special investigation team to probe Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case
371.article_body: A three-member all-women special investigation team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said on Monday. The SIT will probe the case under the supervision of senior IPS officer Gurpreet Kaur Deo. "The SIT will go to the bottom of the conspiracy," DGP Yadav said.

372.title: I surrender in films I commit to: Ayesha on Akshay spitting water in Khiladi
372.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka opened up about a scene in the 1992 film 'Khiladi' in which Akshay Kumar could be seen spitting water on Ayesha's face. "Once I decide to do a project, with all the clarity, then I would go all out, surrender myself," she stated. Ayesha added, "You must say establish don'ts...before you sign the project, which I have."

373.title: Milk production down by 8 lakh litre/day in Rajasthan due to lumpy skin disease
373.article_body: The lumpy skin disease has affected milk production in Rajasthan as the state witnessed a decline of over 21% in milk production during August. As per the Rajasthan Cooperative Dairy Federation (RCDF), milk collection is estimated to have reduced by 6 to 8 lakh litres per day. In some places of western Rajasthan, milk production has come down to zero.

374.title: Unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II released ahead of her funeral today
374.article_body: A previously unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II has been released by Buckingham Palace ahead of her funeral. The portrait was taken by photographer Ranald Mackechnie in Windsor Castle in May, ahead of her Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Britain's longest-serving monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, will be honoured with a full state funeral at Westminster Abbey today.

375.title: We can't have new hires not seeing a TCS office: COO Subramaniam
375.article_body: N Ganapathy Subramaniam, the COO of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said the company "can't have new joinees not seeing a TCS office or interacting with role models as mentors". He said that remote working as the only goal will lead to "a very transactional experience". Notably, only less than 20% of TCS' workforce has reportedly returned to work from office.

376.title: Would have stopped the film if Diljit hadn’t done it: 'Jogi' director
376.article_body: 'Jogi' director Ali Abbas Zafar said he wouldn't have worked on the film if Diljit Dosanjh hadn't agreed to do it. "He is so subtle; only his eyes speak in the film. That's what I wanted in the character - someone understated who rises to the occasion," he said. Ali added, "No one could have done it, apart from Diljit."

377.title: Delhi court stays proceedings against Satyendar Jain, ED seeks trial transfer
377.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday stayed the proceedings in a money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain. This comes after an application filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seeking the transfer of the entire proceedings from a special court. ED had arrested Jain in connection with a case based on a CBI FIR lodged against him in 2017.

378.title: Ranbir says he, Alia, Ayan went to SRK's home to approach him for Brahmastra
378.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent interview, said that he, actress Alia Bhatt and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji went to actor Shah Rukh Khan's house when they had to approach him for 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir said that Khan, without thinking for a second, said that he is on board and will do whatever they would want him to do.

379.title: Remo inspired choreographers to become directors: Bosco Martis
379.article_body: Choreographer Bosco Martis, who is making his directorial debut with 'Rocket Gang', said Remo D'souza inspired choreographers to explore direction. "He is one of the choreographers who has started this journey of transforming from a choreographer to a director and definitely inspired many of us," he said. 'Rocket Gang' stars Aditya Seal and Nikita Dutta in the lead roles.

380.title: 72-year-old Mumbai woman practising law with fake licence for decades arrested
380.article_body: A 72-year-old woman in Mumbai was arrested on Saturday for impersonating a lawyer and practising in a family court without proper authorisation for decades. The woman identified as Mordekai Rebecca Joub alias Mandakini Kashinath Sohini had allegedly been practising in various courts based on a fake lawyer's licence. She has been remanded in BKC police custody.

381.title: Following law & order is too much expectation from SP: UP CM on SP's march
381.article_body: Following law and order is too much of an expectation from Samajwadi Party leaders, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Monday, following SP’s march against the state government. "There is no harm if any party asks their questions in a democratic way. Samajwadi Party should take permission for any procession which should not harm anyone," CM Yogi added.

382.title: Astronaut shares pic of Earth at night from space, asks 'how many nations can you spot'
382.article_body: Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti recently shared a picture of Earth at night from the International Space Station. "From the Atlantic looking East towards the sunrise...how many countries and European cities can you spot? I can see my birthplace," she wrote with the picture. She later shared pictures identifying Germany, Spain, UK, Ireland, Greece and Italy among others.

383.title: SP is jobless, they have nothing to do: UP Dy CM on SP's march
383.article_body: Following Samajwadi Party’s march against UP government, Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Monday said it's not related to the benefit of common people. "If they want to discuss this, they're free to do it in the Assembly," Maurya added. Furthermore, he said, "SP is jobless now, they have nothing to do. Such protests will only create problems for people."

384.title: Teenagers steal 4 autos in Mumbai, make Insta reels in it; detained
384.article_body: A 19-year-old mechanic was arrested and a 14-year-old boy was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly stealing four auto-rickshaws worth ₹3,60,000. The duo was identified from their Instagram reels shot while driving the stolen vehicles. As per police, the main accused Armaan Ansari wanted to own autos and started stealing them from roadside while the minor accompanied him for fun.

385.title: Jet Airways relaunch faces delay amid talks with lenders & engine makers: Report
385.article_body: Jet Airways, under its new owner the Jalan-Kalrock consortium, is reportedly facing a delay in its relaunch that is scheduled for this month. According to people aware of the matter, there are unresolved negotiations between the management and engine makers and the airline's former lenders are seeking settlement of dues before the airline buys or leases aircraft.

386.title: It only had menu about our practice: Ashish Nehra on viral pic with paper in IPL 2022
386.article_body: GT head coach Ashish Nehra opened up about his viral picture with paper during IPL 2022. "The paper had nothing. Don't know why people think [it had something important]." He added, "It just had the menu about our practice session." With GT's IPL 2022 win, Nehra became the first Indian to win IPL title as head coach.

387.title: 90 GTA 6 gameplay videos posted online as Rockstar Games suffers massive leak
387.article_body: Rockstar Games suffered a massive leak with around 90 development videos of its much-awaited Grand Theft Auto (GTA) 6 being posted online by the alleged hacker on GTAForums. Various clips from the video game have depicted male and female playable characters. The videos also show the gameplay in a Miami-like fictional city, in line with earlier reports about the game.

388.title: Sidharth Malhotra meets fans at India Gate amid 'Yodha' shoot
388.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who is currently in Delhi shooting for 'Yodha', met and interacted with his fans at India Gate on Sunday. The actor can be seen shaking everyone's hands and posing for selfies in a video shared by a media account. 'Yodha' is scheduled to be released on November 11 and features Disha Patani and Raashii Khanna.

389.title: Akhilesh, SP leaders take out march to state Assembly against UP govt
389.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, other party leaders and workers on Monday organised a march to the state Assembly, from their party office in Lucknow, against UP government. The Monsoon Session of state legislature will commence today. During the march, party MLAs and MLCs will raise issues of unemployment, price rise, crime against women, etc, SP's Rajendra Chaudhary said yesterday.

390.title: Telangana CM KCR names 9-year-old girl who grew up without name
390.article_body: A nine-year-old girl who grew up without a name as her parents wanted Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to give her one was finally named 'Mahati' by Rao on Sunday. The couple, who are from Jayashankar Bhupalpally district, were active members of the Telangana statehood movement. State CMO tweeted that the family was received by Rao and his wife.

391.title: US forces will defend Taiwan against Chinese invasion: US President Biden
391.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion. Asked to clarify if he meant that unlike in Ukraine, US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion, Biden replied, "Yes." Taiwan expressed "sincere gratitude" to Biden for "affirming the US government's rock-solid promise of security to Taiwan".

392.title: Bihar govt to introduce 'no-bag day', mandatory games period in schools
392.article_body: The Bihar government will be introducing a "no-bag day" rule in schools and a mandatory games period at least once a week to reduce burden on students, an official said on Sunday. "At least once a week, students will come to schools only with their lunch boxes. The day will be devoted to practical and experiential learning," the official added.

393.title: Hurricane Fiona makes landfall in Puerto Rico, leaving island without power
393.article_body: Hurricane Fiona made landfall along Puerto Rico's southwest coast on Sunday, triggering landslides and knocking out power. The storm ripped asphalt from roads, swept away a major bridge, closed airports and led to 'historic' levels of rain. Fiona made landfall with maximum sustained winds of about 140 kilometres per hour, clearing threshold for Category 1 hurricane, National Hurricane Center said.

394.title: Lady Gaga posts pic of her crying as lightning strikes cancel concert in Miami
394.article_body: American singer-songwriter Lady Gaga was recently forced to cut her Miami concert short, due to a tropical thunderstorm. The singer said that lightning strikes were hitting too close to the stadium. Sharing a picture of her crying, Gaga wrote, "I'm sorry I couldn't finish the show it was too dangerous the lightening was being unpredictable and changing moment by moment."

395.title: Was insensitive and depressing, I couldn't take it: Balki on 'Cheeni...' review
395.article_body: While talking about a review that he got for his film 'Cheeni Kum', filmmaker R Balki said that "it was very depressing". "It was the most insensitive review of that time...People were consoling me, but I couldn't take it because it was written about me. So, from then, I decided to stay away from these critics altogether," he added.

396.title: Shinde camp gets nod for Dussehra rally at BKC, Uddhav's application rejected
396.article_body: The MMRDA gave permission to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena faction to hold the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground in Mumbai. Meanwhile, the MMRDA rejected Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena's application for another plot in BKC to hold Dussehra rally, saying the plot has already been booked for another event.

397.title: KTR asks MP to adopt temple with stepwell in Ranga Reddy, MP agrees
397.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday wished Chevella MP Ranjith Reddy on his birthday and asked him to adopt the Balaji temple with stepwell near Shamshabad in Ranga Reddy. Ranjith replied to Rao, saying, "Would love to take up this wonderful initiative and revive...heritage of Telangana." This comes after a person tweeted that the "700-year-old" temple wasn't being maintained.

398.title: BJP launches 15-day 'Praja Poru Yatra' in Andhra Pradesh
398.article_body: The BJP launched a 15-day "Praja Poru Yatra" from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam against the YSRCP government. The Poru Yatra will cover 5,000 street corner meetings in 175 Assembly constituencies of the state in the next 15 days. "The YSRCP government has completely failed to rule in Andhra Pradesh. Real problems of people are neglected," said BJP MP GVL Narasimha Rao.

399.title: Kartik Aaryan returns to airport gate to meet young fan, video viral
399.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing actor Kartik Aaryan returning to the gate of Jodhpur airport to meet a fan who was screaming his name. The actor can be seen speaking to the security personnel and asking the fan and her guardian to click pictures from outside the gate. The fans were later allowed to meet Kartik.

400.title: Goa CM and Congress turncoat MLAs to meet PM Modi in Delhi
400.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant and eight MLAs who ditched the Congress to join the BJP will be meeting PM Narendra Modi in Delhi today. The Congress turncoats are also likely to meet BJP President JP Nadda and Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "All the MLAs have joined us because they believe in the vision of PM Modi," said Sawant.

401.title: Govt awards 60 startups, gives ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students
401.article_body: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh presented INSPIRE Awards to 60 startups for innovation and ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students to help develop prototypes of ideas submitted, the Ministry of Science and Technology said. More than 6 lakh people from across the country participated in the annual INSPIRE Awards - MANAK (Million Minds Augmenting National Aspiration and Knowledge), the minister said.
